moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4: Conway's first mistake. Morphy absolutely thrives on open positions.
moves.3. Nf3: Preventing ...Q-R5 ch and developing the Knight to its natural square.
moves.4. Bc4: Already bearing down on the weakened K-position.
moves.5. d4: Opening more lines and seizing the center.
moves.5... gxf3: Greedily snatching the material instead of developing his pieces. Tsk, tsk, tsk...
moves.7. O-O: Lining up a battery on the KB file.
moves.7... Ne7: Normally this would allow the K to reach safety by castling. But with the KN file as an avenue of attack...
moves.8. Bxf4: Blasting open the KB file a Pawn at at time.
moves.9. Bxf7+: Removing the King's last bit of cover.
moves.10... Kg7: The King is now an orphan in a rapidly intensifying storm.

players: Paul Morphy  vs. M. Daniel Conway
